intro: Lastrea expansa, commonly known as the broadleaf lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens in regions with warm climates.
